required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiation Dosimetry, Metabolism, Safety, Tolerability and Positron Emission Tomography/Computed Tomography (PET/CT) Imaging With BAY 85-8050 in Healthy Volunteers and Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Open-label, Multicenter Study for an Evaluation of Radiation Dosimetry, Metabolism, Safety and Tolerability of the [F18] Labeled PET (Positron Emission Tomography) Tracer BAY 85-8050 Following a Single Intravenous Administration in Healthy Volunteers, as Well as the Investigation of Safety, Tolerability and Diagnostic Performance of the Tracer in PET/CT (Computer Tomography) in Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a visual assessment of diagnostic PET/CT images obtained after a single intravenous injection of BAY85-8050 in patients with cancer

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within up to 2 hours after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitative analysis of BAY 85-8050 uptake into lesions (Standardized Uptake Values, SUVs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within up to 2 hours after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum chemistry:Glutamate pyruvate transaminase (GPT/ALAT), gamma-glutamyl transferase (gamma-GT), glutamate-oxaloacetate transaminase (GOT), alkaline phosphatase, total bilirubin, creatinine, total protein
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At least 2 times within 8 days after treatment
at least 2 times within 8 days after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital signs: Heart rate, blood pressure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at least 2 times within 8 days after treatment
continuously for at least 8 days after treatment

intervention.description: Cancer patients, injection of BAY 85-8050, PET/CT
Healthy volunteers, injection of BAY 85-8050, whole body PET/CT for determination of effective dose, kinetics of BAY 85-8050 in blood

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers only
- Males/females, >/=50 and </= 65 years of age
- Cancer patients only
- Males/females >/= 35 years and </= 75 years of age
- Patient had an FDG PET/CT for detection, or staging, or restaging, or therapy response assessment that still showed tumor mass
Exclusion Criteria:
- Concurrent severe and/or uncontrolled and/or unstable other medical disease (e.g. poorly controlled diabetes, congestive heart failure, myocardial infarction within 12 months prior to planned injection of BAY85-8050, unstable and uncontrolled hypertension, chronic renal or hepatic disease, severe pulmonary disease) which could compromise participation in the study
- Known sensitivity to the study drug or components of the preparation
